conclusion: Analyze forces acting on suitcase to find coefficient of friction and angle of pull.
Gravitational force on suitcase is 150 N.
Pulling force is 90 N; normal force exerted by ground; frictional force proportional to normal force.
Pulling force has horizontal and vertical components.
Horizontal component of pulling force is F_x = F cos θ.
Vertical component of pulling force is F_y = F sin θ.
Net force in horizontal direction is zero due to uniform movement.
Horizontal force balance: F_x = F_f = μN.
Net force in vertical direction is zero.
Vertical force balance: N + F_y = F_g.
Normal force N = 150 N - 90 sin θ.
Horizontal balance equation: 90 cos θ = μ(150 - 90 sin θ).
Given sin 37° = 0.6; assume θ = 37° to check equation.
Calculate cos 37° using Pythagorean identity: cos 37° = 0.8.
